content:
My name is Eliav Mor and I’m an M.Sc Computer Science student at Tel Aviv university and an Algorithm Engineer at Samsung Research Israel Center.
I enjoy expanding my knowledge in computer science, coding, and solving theoretical problems. I am passionate about problem solving, algorithms, and out-of-the-box thinking. In my free time I like hiking, running, and making pottery.
summary:

I enjoy expanding my knowledge in computer science, coding, and solving theoretical problems.
title: Eliav Mor
Do Language Models Understand Frequent Words Better?

content:
As part of of my passion to CV algorithms, I challenged myself to implement a real-time algorithm for face detection from scratch.
For more details please visit my github.

title: Face Detection Using Viola Jonas

content:
A simple reinforcement learning (snake) game that I wrote for fun while exploring RL during my Master. The learning algorithm of the snake is based on Monte-Carlo using every visit update.
For more details please visit my github and clone the code!
summary: A simple reinforcement learning (snake) game that I wrote for fun while exploring RL during my Master. The learning algorithm of the snake is based on Monte-Carlo using every visit update.
title: MonteCarlo Snake
